required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Performance Evaluation of Veye Lung Nodules
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Performance Evaluation of Veye Lung Nodules

brief_summary.textblock:
Veye Lung Nodules (Aidence B.V., Amsterdam, the Netherlands) is a medical software device that is intended to assist radiologists with pulmonary nodule management on CT chest scans.
This clinical trial aims to assess the clinical performance of Veye Lung nodules via a standalone performance evaluation and a reader study.

primary_outcome.description: Demonstrate that the accuracy for detecting actionable pulmonary nodules by radiologists using the device (AIDED) is superior to that of radiologists not using the device (UNAIDED)

secondary_outcome.description: Demonstrate that the accuracy for segmenting actionable pulmonary nodules by the device is non-inferior to expert radiologists

other_outcome.description: Demonstrate that the accuracy for determining volume change of actionable pulmonary nodules by the device is non-inferior to expert radiologists

Demonstrate that the accuracy for classifying the composition of actionable pulmonary nodules by radiologists using the device (AIDED) is superior to that of radiologists not using the device (UNAIDED)

arm_group.description: Intervention is the use of Veye Lung Nodules during the reading of the CT scans

study_pop.textblock: US adult population that received a CT chest scan either as part of a lung cancer screening program or during routine practice
